help.upload_flat_file_help:
Provide a plain text file (.txt format) containing a list of hosts to be registered in the following formats:

Agent | Host_Name | connection string


For Open Source Based Hosts:

intel|Host_Name|OpenSource_Connection_String

e.g. intel|HostIP|https://HostIP:1443/;login;password


For VMWare Based Hosts:

vmware|Host_Name|Vmware_Connection_String*

e.g. vmware|myVmwareHost|https://vCenterServer:443/sdk;Administrator;Password


For Citrix Type

citrix|Host_Name|Citrix_Connection_String*

e.g. citrix|myCitrixHost|https://myCitrixHost:443/;Administrator;Password


* Connection strings must be valid urls. Please notice the / after the port number. This is required.
help.vcenter_string_help:
Please provide the hostname or IP address of VCenter. If the default port [443] is not used, specify the same after ":" as shown below.

Ex: hostname.com

Ex: 192.168.1.1

Ex: 192.168.1.0:444
help.required_pcr_values_help:
This option allows the user to add additonal PCRs to be used for White Listing.


By default the tool always retrieves the minimum required PCRs based on the host type and TPM version.

For TPM 1.2:

PCR[0]- Holds the Core Root of Trust Measurement (CRTM) including BIOS start-up code, Power-on-self-test, and other OEM provided code such as embedded Option ROMs and other Host Platform Extensions.

PCR[1]- Host Platform Configuration measurement which includes BIOS setup or devices controlled by embedded Option ROMS.

PCR[2]- Option ROM Code measures option ROM code for add-in devices not provided by the OEM as an embedded device (e.g., PCI RAID adaptor, Network adaptor, etc.).

PCR[3]- Option ROM Configuration and Data - measures configuration data covered by option ROM code for add-in devices not provided by the OEM.

PCR[4]- IPL code that performs the initial boot, usually the Master Boot Record (MBR).

PCR[5]- IPL Configuration and Data (i.e., the configuration and data used by the IPL Code).

PCR[17]- Code and data associated with the secure launch process [SINIT, BIOS ACM, & Launch Control Policies.

PCR[18]- Measurement of the MLE [Tboot + First module in the grub.conf (if applicable)]

PCR[19-20]- Measurement of the core kernel module(s).

For TPM 2.0, the MLE measurement is extended to PCR 17 and Intel public signing key and policies are extended to PCR 18 if TXT/Tboot is enabled.
help.required_pcr_bank_help:
This option only applies to a host with TPM2.0 chip and will be ignored for a host with TPM1.2. Since TPM2.0 may support multiple PCR banks, this option allows the user to choose a specific PCR bank for a host with TPM2.0 to be attested with.

Auto- Default selection. The system will choose the strongest algorithm in the PCR banks the host TPM supports

SHA256- SHA256 PCR bank on TPM2.0 is selected.

SHA1- SHA1 PCR bank on TPM 2.0 is selected.
help.applicable_whitelist_target_help:
This option allows users to choose how the white list is configured.


BIOS Configuration

Select the OEM Option to provide whitelist for each OEM Type and BIOS Version.  All the Servers/Hosts of a given OEM Type & BIOS Version will be verified with this Whitelist.

Select the HOST option to provide whitelist by Host and BIOS Version. (ex: for HP Servers, by design PCR 0 measurement changes for every host).


Hypervisor (VMM) Configuration

Select the OEM Option to provide whitelist for each OEM Type and VMM/OS Version.  All the Servers/Hosts of a given OEM Type & VMM/OS Version will be verified with this Whitelist.

Select the HOST option to provide whitelist by Host and VMM/OS Version. This whitelist will be used to verify ONLY the specified host.

Select the GLOBAL option to provide the whitelist for each VMM/OS version and build number. All the servers/hosts across all OEM types run this specified VMM/OS version and build will be verified with this whitelist.
help.configure_white_help:
This option allows the user to choose the White Lists that need to be configured.

Depending on host type and TPM version, the following PCRs are selected:

Citrix Xen:
BIOS: 0, 17 VMM: 18, 19

Linux KVM:
TPM 1.2:
BIOS: 0, 17 VMM: 18, 19
TPM 2.0:
BIOS: 0, 17 VMM: 17, 18, 19

Linux Xen:
BIOS: 0, 17 VMM: 18, 19

VMware ESXi:
BIOS: 0, 17 VMM: 18, 19, 20

Windows:
BIOS: 0 VMM: 13, 14

If both BIOS and VMM are selected, user will get an option to register the host also when he/she clicks on the 'Upload White List' button.
help.pcr_help:
PCR[0]- Holds the Core Root of Trust Measurement (CRTM) including BIOS start-up code, Power-on-self-test, and other OEM provided code such as embedded Option ROMs and other Host Platform Extensions.

PCR[1]- Host Platform Configuration measurement which includes BIOS setup or devices controlled by embedded Option ROMS.

PCR[2]- Option ROM Code � measures option ROM code for add-in devices not provided by the OEM as an embedded device (e.g., PCI RAID adaptor, Network adaptor, etc.).

PCR[3]- Option ROM Configuration and Data - measures configuration data covered by option ROM code for add-in devices not provided by the OEM.

PCR[4]- IPL code that performs the initial boot, usually the Master Boot Record (MBR).

PCR[5]- IPL Configuration and Data (i.e., the configuration and data used by the IPL Code).

PCR[17]- Code and data associated with the secure launch process.

PCR[18]- Measurement of the tBoot package.

PCR[19-20]- Measurement of the key packages of the of the MLE.
help.upload_manifest_file_help:
Please provide file in following format :

PCR Name:PCR Value

e.g. 17:BFC3FFD7940E9281A3EBFDFA4E0412869A3F55D8
help.manifest_loader_tool:
White List Manifest Loader Tool :



* The White List Manifest Loader Tool installation package comes along with the WLM Portal installation. [C:\inetpub\wwwroot\WLMPortal\WLMLoaderToo\].

* The tool can be installed either on the same server as the WLM portal or on system that is on the same network as the Mt. Wilson database.

* The pre-requisite for running the tool is the .NET Framework 4.0.

* Detailed documentation on the configuration and running of the tool would be available to the user post installation.
help.role_description_help:
Security - Allows user full privileges on all the resources. Kept for backward compatibility.

Whitelist - Allows user full privileges on oem, os and mle (whitelist) resources. Kept for backward compatibility.

Attestation - Allows user to full privileges on hosts and host attestations. Kept for backward compatibility.

Report - Allows user to search and retrieve all system resources. Kept for backward compatibility.

Audit - Allows user to search and retrieve all system resources. Kept for backward compatibility.

AssetTagManagement - Allows user full privileges on tag attributes, tag selections, tag certificates and tpm passwords. Also provides search and retrieve privileges on configuration, files and host resources. Kept for backward compatibility.

Administrator - Allows user full privileges on all the resources.

Asset Tag Manager - Allows user full privileges on tag attributes, tag selections, tag certificates and tpm passwords. Also provides search and retrieve privileges on configuration, files and host resources.

Auditor - Allows user to search and retrieve all system resources.

Challenger - Allows user to request for a new attestation on any of the hosts. Also provides search and retrieve privileges on host, mle, oem and os resources.

Host Manager - Allows user full privileges on the host resource. Also provides search and retrieve privileges on tag certificate, mle, oem and os resources.

Report Manager - Allows user to search and retrieve all system resources.

Server Manager - Allows user to full privileges on configuration, file, role and role permission resources.

Tls Policy Manager - Allows user to full privileges on create new TLS policies that could be used during whitelisting and host registration to connect to the host.

User Manager - Allows user full privileges for user creation, and configuration against basic, hmac and certificate based authentication.

Whitelist Manager - Allows user full privileges on oem, os and mle (whitelist) resources.
